paper_title.ja: 下顎骨炎を併発した関節突起部を含む下顎骨線維性骨異形成症の1例

paper_title.en: Localised amyloidosis of the palate: Multislice helical computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging findings

description.en: Localised amyloidosis in the head and neck is a rare disease. This report presents a 43-year-old woman with localised amyloidosis of the hard palate. Multislice helical computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging findings are discussed. Computed tomography findings are non-specific with various degrees of contrast enhancement resulting from the degree of vascularity in the lesion. Signal intensities on both T1-and T2-weighted magnetic resonance images resemble those of skeletal muscle, and significant enhancement on enhanced T1-weighted magnetic resonance imaging is noted.

publication_name.en: Asian Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery

paper_title.ja: 上顎洞、鼻腔を大きく圧排した腺様歯原性腫瘍の1例(共著）

description.ja: 11歳女児.回転パノラマX線写真で埋伏歯を含む嚢胞様病変を指摘された.生検を施行し,病理組織学的診断は腺様歯原性腫瘍(AOT)であった.全身麻酔下にて上顎洞前壁,犬歯窩より開洞し腫瘍摘出術施行し,更に後上方に存在した右側上顎犬歯を抜歯した.腫瘍摘出腔上方の上顎洞底の骨に一部吸収が認められたので,周囲の非薄な骨を除去し,固有上顎洞と連続させた.術後右頬部に知覚異常を訴えた他には異常は認められなかった.術後2ヵ月の経過観察時には,知覚異常はほぼ消失し,口蓋及び顔面部には膨隆等異常所見は認められなかった.現在術後1年半経過するが,再発等は認められず経過良好である

publication_name.ja: 日本口腔診断学会雑誌

paper_title.ja: Sex differences in the hemoglobin oxygenation state of the resting healthy human masseter muscle
Squamous Odontogenic tumor like proliferation in an odontogenic keratocyst with infiltration of muscle tissue:Report of a case

publication_name.ja: Asian Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery

description.ja: 30歳男.口腔内の荒れた感じと歯肉からの出血を主訴とした.初診時,硬口蓋に白斑を伴う紅斑性病変を,口唇粘膜に白斑を認めた.舌は大部分が白斑で被われ,溝状舌がみられた.硬口蓋部粘膜の生検で乾癬の典型像を認め,全身症状がみられなかったことから口腔乾癬と診断した.治療は抗真菌剤とアズレン製剤の含嗽薬及び副腎皮質ホルモン剤の噴霧・軟膏塗布を行い,症状はかなり軽減したが完全には消失しなかった

publication_name.ja: 日本口腔診断学会雑誌

paper_title.ja: 下顎前歯部舌側歯肉に生じた歯原性扁平上皮腫の1例
paper_title.en: A case of squamous odontogenic tumor in the anterior lingual gingiva of the mandible

description.ja:
We report a case of peripheral squamous odontogenic tumor, which is a rare benign odontogenic tumor. The patient was a 30-year-old man who presented with a painless swelling in the gingiva of the anterior teeth of the mandible. The mass was hemispherical and dark brown. No abnormality was found in the surrounding tissue. There were no findings on dental radiographs or computed tomographic scans.
Under local anesthesia, the mass, including the periosteum, was enucleated. The underlying bone had not been resorbed. The removed specimen measured 10×8×4mm and was elastic hard.
Histologically, the specimen was composed of numerous nests of well-differentiated squamous epithelium in fibrous connective tissue. Each of the epithelial nests had a peripheral layer of cuboidal or squamous cells. There was occasional microcystic generation and calcification. No dysplasia was present. Based on these findings, the lesion was diagnosed as a peripheral squamous odontogenic tumor. Healing was uneventful, and there has been no evidence of recurrence as of 1 year postoperatively.
description.en:
We report a case of peripheral squamous odontogenic tumor, which is a rare benign odontogenic tumor. The patient was a 30-year-old man who presented with a painless swelling in the gingiva of the anterior teeth of the mandible. The mass was hemispherical and dark brown. No abnormality was found in the surrounding tissue. There were no findings on dental radiographs or computed tomographic scans.
Under local anesthesia, the mass, including the periosteum, was enucleated. The underlying bone had not been resorbed. The removed specimen measured 10×8×4mm and was elastic hard.
Histologically, the specimen was composed of numerous nests of well-differentiated squamous epithelium in fibrous connective tissue. Each of the epithelial nests had a peripheral layer of cuboidal or squamous cells. There was occasional microcystic generation and calcification. No dysplasia was present. Based on these findings, the lesion was diagnosed as a peripheral squamous odontogenic tumor. Healing was uneventful, and there has been no evidence of recurrence as of 1 year postoperatively.

paper_title.ja: 顎関節症患者における上関節腔内麻酔後時間経過が疼痛評価に及ぼす影響(共著）
paper_title.en: Influence of time after superior articular cavity anesthesia on pain evaluation in patients with temporomandibular disorders

description.ja:
Clinically, the location of pain in patients with temporomandibular disorders (TMD) is diagnosed by palpation and interview of the patient during mandibular movement. However, some patients cannot clearly indicate the location of the pain. Local anesthesia of the painful region described by the patient is often recommended to block nociceptors and to diagnose the source of pain. However, this method does not consider the time after anesthesia or infiltration of anesthesia into the surrounded tissue with the passage of time.
Aims: The aim of this study was to investigate the influence of the time after superior joint cavity anesthesia on the evaluation of pain in patients with unilateral TMD who have both temporomandibular joint (TMJ) and musculature pain.
Methods: Thirty-five patients (aged 14-75 years) who had TMD with unilateral TMJ and musculature pain were included. Lidocaine was injected directly into the superior cavity. A set of 13 tests was performed before anesthesia, and 1 and 5 minutes after anesthesia: 3 muscle palpation tests, 2 TMJ palpation tests, 6 comprehensive pain tests, and 2 other evaluations.
Results: The pain of the muscle and TMJ significantly decreased in response to joint anesthesia. Joint anesthesia did not affect the results of muscle palpation tests in 14% to 39% of the patients, those of TMJ palpation tests in 29% to 36% of the patients, and those of comprehensive pain tests in 32% to 50% of the patients 1 minute after anesthesia. However, these tests showed no significant pain between 1 minute and 5 minutes after anesthesia except for two of the comprehensive pain tests (chin compression and the distance of mouth opening without pain). Numbness of the front of the pinna, used as an index of the infiltration of anesthetic into the surrounding TMJ, did not differ significantly between before anesthesia and 1 minute after anesthesia, but increased significantly 5 minutes after anesthesia.
Conclusion: Tests designed to locate the source of pain in TMD by the direct injection of an anesthetic into the superior cavity should be carried out 1 minute after anesthesia, before the anesthetic has infiltrated into the surrounding tissue.

paper_title.en: Influence of time after superior articular cavity anesthesia on pain evaluation in patients with Temporomandibular disorders

description.ja:
Clinically, the location of pain in patients with temporomandibular disorders (TMD) is diagnosed by palpation and interview of the patient during mandibular movement. However, some patients cannot clearly indicate the location of the pain. Local anesthesia of the painful region described by the patient is often recommended to block nociceptors and to diagnose the source of pain.
